title: Excellent!
text:
The place was new, fresh, with all the necessary commodities. (Always happy time see air conditioners in the south!) The location is good - it’s a nice neighborhood and about 20min walk into downtown, even faster with transportation. The communication from the hosts was fast, well mannered and always ready to help with anything we needed! Special thanks to Niko!
We were also given a free upgrade, which is always a pleasant experience.
All in all, Omnia Pagrati Apartments hosted us for a week and we couldn’t be happier with our choice!

title: A+ quick breakfast
text: A really nice place to grab a quick bite for breakfast and/or along the day! Stopped by a number of times during our trip and quite enjoyed it! Our favorites were the spinach sandwich and the cinnamon roll!

title: Wonderful views
text: The historical monument provides with spectacular views of the city and the water. For adventure seekers there is a more challenging way to the top, while regular tourists can just find a road to the top. A nice place to visit when in the area!

title: Beautiful sights
text: Besides the obvious lure of the history and the intriguing ruins, I was very impressed by the mesmerizing sights from up above.

title: Beautiful piece of history
text: Visiting the theatre was a nice escape from the routine city spots. Seemingly quiet and out of sight, standing at the bottom of ‘the stage’ left me happy with the choice to see this place in person.

title: Unexpected gem!
text: Was set as a stop on a bigger tour and I didn’t think much of it, but the sight left me positively surprised! I can say that I have formed an admiration of sorts for this historical element!

title: Was I even there?
text:
Had higher expectations. We came to the restaurant and no one didn’t seem to notice. Had to go ‘find the staff’ to take our order. While they were perfectly polite interacting, I just felt like they didn’t care that I was there.
On the positive side, as a tourist and a vegetarian this place gave me the chance to try a national Greek dish - moussaka.

title: Lovely ambiance, great breakfast
text: Lovely ambiance, great breakfast food! I recommend this spot for brunch, the menu is quite wide and will definitely leave you full!

title: Fun break!
text: There’s not much to do there, but we got an absolute kick out of the little candy land! A complete cut off of the grey looking area into a complete color swirl! Not to mention all the luscious cakes, sweets, ice-creams! A fun pit-stop on your journey to explore Athens!

title: Light entertainment
text: I was somehow hoping for a little more than what they had, but I don’t regret going. The exhibits were nice, but mind you it’s all physics - no magic tricks involved. Is probably very much fun and a great way to entertain the kids after dragging them through the historical sights.

title: Do it!
text: The hike is quite difficult, that of course mostly depend on your condition, but the views on top are amazing and if you’re in Athens you should do it! Doesn’t take much time, it’s free and it has amazing reviews from up top!

title: One from the list
text: We bought the ticket that includes all the historical sites, which is the main reason we went. There’s very little left form the ruins and not much to see. But if you have a tour guide by your side, the experience might be much more interesting!

title: History
text: One sight is on the historical attraction too do’ list, but I actually enjoyed it. Not much left, but the existing beams are quite nice and the gate is beautiful.

title: One from the list
text: We bought the ticket that includes all the historical sites, which is the main reason we went. There’s very little left form the ruins and not much to see. But if you have a tour guide by your side, the experience might be much more interesting!

title: Beautiful
text: A beautiful place! A nice park that holds beautiful monuments and a museum. We did not enter the museum, but the building was lovely!

title: One from the list
text: We bought the ticket that includes all the historical sites, which is the main reason we went. There’s very little left form the ruins and not much to see. But if you have a tour guide by your side, the experience might be much more interesting!

title: Surreal
text:
We had an exceptional chance to see the monument at a time with very few tourists around. A beautiful place, outstanding views, so much history around you.
Only down side was the construction work which kind of messed with the authenticity, but there’s nothing you can really do about it and I wouldn’t say that you’d necessarily have to wait until they’re done to visit. It’s amazing regardless!

title: Left wanting for more!
text: As a vegetarian, it is often a struggle to dine in restaurants as even if they have vegetarian options they’re fairly limited. Jut by looking at the menu I could tell I wanted half of the things on it! We ended up having a ‘curry dish’ and and ‘mushroom pasta’ (sorry they had fancy names but I cannot remember). Regardless, the food was outstanding, the staff was very nice, location is also very easily accessible if you in the center. Will definitely go back and suggest you to do the same!

title: Yes!
text: Good service, great view, wonderful ambiance. Had the Greek melt and absolutely loved it! Recommend!

title: Bad service, bad food!
text:
Ordered a mushroom pasta - there we three tiny mushroom pieces in the dish and the rest was tomato sauce and cheese. Oh, and a big chunk of plain tasteless pasta.
Speaking of the tomato sauce, the waiter spilled some on my white dress while setting it on the table!!! I got a ‘sorry’, but that’s about it.
Very disappointed in the restaurant and do not recommend, I’m sure you can find better Italian food elsewhere if your truly craving it!

title: Just what you need!
text: Went for lunch, the falafel and the sweet potato burger were absolutely amazing! And the service was very nice. Recommend!

title: A must for breakfast lovers!
text:
Went to this place whilst in Porto and came back in Lisbon! Such an amazing place for breakfast lovers! The atmosphere and the look of the place is real nice, but the food is to die for! Although for some reason not a big fan of their coffee (americano black) - maybe it’s just the blend.
As a local I’d come back time and time again!

title: YUM
text:
My Portuguese friend suggested the place. The ice cream was absolutely yum! They say it’s freshly made with natural ingredients and sugars and no additional preservatives. While I have no way of confirming this, the taste did seem very natural and fresh!
Many flavors to choose from and decent prices!

title: Rave!
text: Was traveling with my sister and the place was recommended to us by my friend whose a local. We absolutely loved it! From the vibe and the funky look of it, to the shops, the food and even the scenery of the 25 de Abril bridge! Definitely a stop worth making once the historical sights get too heavy!

title: Fine ride
text: Oddly enough, jumped on it not realizing it was THE TRAM to be on when in Lisbon, when actually just needed to get downtown from my hotel. Not much to the experience beside the ‘tourist factor’ and a lot of people use it for everyday travel. The ticket was 3€ (I was able to buy it with the driver). Only minus - it doesn’t in any way show you the stops, so while the locals know them by heart and most tourists just get on it for the ride, I was actually looking to get to a certain stop and it was a bit of a head scratcher. Tho the driver was nice enough to tell us where to get off when I asked him.

title: Adored it!
text: Let’s start by saying the the entire neighborhood had an amazing vibe and this place was no exception! The menu was good, although all in Portuguese and they had to translate some things for me as a tourist. I ordered the ‘everyday brunch’ which was amazing! I loved it from beginning to end - it was fresh, delicious and with a decent price on it!

title: An option
text: The food was good, although not that many choices. Had run out of oat milk, so weren’t able to make the ordered drink. You order at the counter, but it’s confusing as some things we had to pick up at the counter - when the came and told us, - whilst others they brought to our table.

title: A maybe
text:
Chose this out of what I considered to be limited selection for lunch options in Peniche due to my preferences as a vegetarian. The place was nice. Menu seemed more ‘fresh’ than the food actually turned out to be. My ‘avocado toast’ ended up having salmon, cause that’s supposedly what they usually put in it. Tho, they did apologize and re-do it, it was a wait. My sister ordered a chicken wrap - got it all, but the actual chicken. Plus the banana milkshake was 1/10 banana and thus no flavor.
We got fed, it was ok, but I won’t be coming back anytime soon.

title: Ideal breakfast place
text: Went to Zenith two days in a row! Wide selection, healthy and very tasty breakfast foods. Fast and pleasant service from the staff! Would recommend!

title: Loved it!
text: Amazing brunch offer, lovely atmosphere and great value for money! Polite and welcoming staff. Highly recommend!
